messages.message: For a given sandbox/environment, is there a quick way to know what version of instabase is deployed to that environment?

not sure how for sandboxes not deployed through jenkins, but I've been looking at jenkins logs for dogfood's deploy to see which commit is deployed https://jenkins.instabase.com/blue/organizations/jenkins/deploy-dogfood/detail/deploy-dogfood/4635/pipeline/10
One way is you can check the commit hash from “About Instabase”
how do you get to that page?

I use kubectl if I'm verifying a specific deployment to a specific service

```KUBECONFIG=~/.kube/docinsights kubectl -n instabase describe deployment/deployment-celery-app-tasks```
It gives all sorts of info but you can look for these vars
```      RELEASE_BRANCH:                               
      RELEASE_TAG:                                  
      RELEASE_COMMIT_ID:                            ```
